metadata.title: CVE-2024-35842 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ASoC:mediatek: sof-common: Add NULL check for normal_link string It's notgranted that all entries of struct sof_conn_stream declare a `normal_link`(a non-SOF, direct link) string, and this is the case for SoCs that supportonly SOF paths (hence do not support both direct and SOF usecases). Forexample, in the case of MT8188 there is no normal_link string in any of thesof_conn_stream entries and there will be more drivers doing that in thefuture. To avoid possible NULL pointer KPs, add a NULL check for`normal_link`.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
